abilities.name: Adaptable
abilities.description: The race has great variation among its people and cultures. Characters start with a free Novice Edge of their choice (and must meet all the Edge’s Requirements).

abilities.name: Additional Action
abilities.description: The being has additional appendages, enhanced reflexes, or exceptional eye-hand coordination. He may ignore 2 points of Multi-Action penalties each turn.

abilities.name: Aquatic/Semi-Aquatic
abilities.description: For one point the character is semi-aquatic and can hold his breath for 15 minutes before checking for drowning. For two, he’s native to the water. He cannot drown in oxygenated liquid and moves his full Pace when swimming (see Movement, page 92).

abilities.name: Armor
abilities.description: The species has a thick hide or is encrusted in solid material like scaly plating or even rock. This grants Armor +2 each time it’s taken.

abilities.name: Attribute Increase
abilities.description: During character creation, the species increases a particular attribute (Agility, Smarts, Spirit, Strength, or Vigor) one die type. This increases the Trait’s maximum by one as well.

abilities.name: Bite
abilities.description: The race has fangs that cause Strength+d4 damage. See Natural Weapons, page 104 for more information.

abilities.name: Burrowing
abilities.description: The species can burrow into loose earth and move through it at half normal Pace (he cannot run). He cannot normally be attacked while burrowing, and can attempt to surprise opponents who didn’t see him coming by making an opposed Stealth vs. Notice roll. If successful, the burrower adds +2 to his attack and damage rolls that round, or +4 with a raise (he has The Drop, page 100).

abilities.name: Claws
abilities.description: The race has claws that cause Str+d4 damage. One more point may be spent to increase their damage to Strength+d6, and/or another to add AP 2. See Natural Weapons, page 104 for more information.

abilities.name: Construct
abilities.description: Constructs are artificial beings made of inorganic material. They add +2 to recover from being Shaken, ignore one level of Wound modifiers, don’t breathe, and are immune to disease and poison. Wounds must be mended via the Repair skill. Each attempt takes one hour per current Wound level and ignores the “Golden Hour”. Many Constructs have the Dependency Negative Racial Ability (reflecting their need for a power source).

abilities.name: Doesn’t Breathe
abilities.description: The species does not breathe. Individuals aren’t affected by inhaled toxins, can’t drown, and don’t suffocate in a vacuum. (They may still freeze, however.)

abilities.name: Edge
abilities.description: All members of this race have the same innate Edge chosen from those available in the setting. Unlike Adaptable, this ability ignores Requirements except other Edges. Each Rank beyond Novice costs an additional point to a maximum of Heroic Rank (5).

abilities.name: Environmental Resistance
abilities.description: The species receives a +4 bonus to resist a single negative environmental effect, such as heat, cold, lack of air, radiation, etc. Damage from that source is also reduced by 4.

abilities.name: Flight
abilities.description: The species can fly at Pace 6 (or 12 for 4 points) and “run” for extra movement as usual. For 6 points, the being can fly at Pace 24 and may “run” for 2d6″ of additional movement. Maneuvering uses the Athletics skill. Racial flight presumes some kind of wings which can be targeted or fouled (a Bound or Entangled character cannot fly).

abilities.name: Hardy
abilities.description: A second Shaken result in combat does not cause a Wound.

abilities.name: Horns
abilities.description: The being has a horn or horns that cause Str+d4 damage (or Str+d6 for 2 points). See Natural Weapons, page 104, for more information.

abilities.name: Immune to Poison or Disease
abilities.description: The species is immune to poison or disease (your choice). It may be taken twice for both effects.

abilities.name: Infravision
abilities.description: The creature “sees” heat, either through eyes or other sensory organs. This halves Illumination penalties when attacking warm targets (including invisible beings).

abilities.name: Leaper
abilities.description: The character can jump twice as far as listed under Movement, page 92. In addition, he adds +4 to damage when leaping as part of a Wild Attack instead of the usual +2 (unless in a closed or confined space where he cannot leap horizontally or vertically—GM’s call).

abilities.name: Low Light Vision
abilities.description: The being ignores penalties for Dim or Dark illumination (but not Pitch Darkness).

abilities.name: No Vital Organs
abilities.description: These species have hidden, extremely tough, or redundant vital organs. Called Shots do no extra damage against them.

abilities.name: Pace
abilities.description: The character’s Pace is increased by +2 and his running die is increased a die type.

abilities.name: Parry
abilities.description: The creature’s natural Parry is increased by +1. This may be due to a prehensile tail, extra limbs, enhanced reflexes, or even latent psi-sense.

abilities.name: Poisonous Touch
abilities.description: With a successful Touch Attack (page 108), bite, or claw, the victim must roll Vigor or suffer the effects of Mild Poison. For 3 points the poison can be upgraded to Knockout, Lethal, or Paralyzing instead, but each use causes the hero Fatigue. The character may always choose whether or not to use her poison touch. See page 128 for Poison and its effects.

abilities.name: Power
abilities.description: The race has an innate ability that functions like a power (see page 147). For 2 points, she has Arcane Background (Gifted) and a power that reflects her unusual ability. Each time this is taken after the first costs 1 point and grants another power. It does not increase her Power Points—use the Power Points Edge for that.

abilities.name: Reach
abilities.description: Long limbs, tentacles, etc. grant the creature Reach +1 (add +1 each time it’s taken after the first).

abilities.name: Regeneration
abilities.description: The being heals damage quickly. She may make a natural healing roll once per day (rather than every five days). For 3 points, permanent injuries may be recovered once all other Wounds are regenerated. Treat each injury as an additional Wound for purposes of recovery (the being may try once per week).

abilities.name: Size +1
abilities.description: The creature is larger than normal. Each point of Size adds directly to Toughness and increases maximum Strength one step. Large species may have difficulty using equipment designed for more traditional humanoids. See page 106 for more on Size.

abilities.name: Skill
abilities.description: The character starts with a d4 in a skill inherent to her race or culture. For 2 points (or 1 if already a core skill), it starts at d6 and the skill’s maximum increases to d12+1.

abilities.name: Skill Bonus
abilities.description: Biological factors give the race a +1/+2 bonus when using a particular skill. A race that emits pheromones, for example, might have a +1 bonus to Persuasion.

abilities.name: Sleep Reduction
abilities.description: The being needs half the normal amount of sleep as humans. If taken a second time, the being never sleeps.

abilities.name: Super Powers
abilities.description: The race has truly extraordinary abilities taken from the Savage Worlds Super Powers Companion. The cost is 2—for Arcane Background (Super Powers)—plus the actual cost of the power selected (X). Make sure you have the GM’s permission before taking this powerful ability.

abilities.name: Toughness
abilities.description: The character has hardened skin, scales, or extremely dense tissue that increases his base Toughness by +1.

abilities.name: Wall Walker
abilities.description: The species may walk on vertical surfaces normally, or inverted surfaces at half Pace.
